definition: to extract/to squeeze out (juice etc)/(fig.) to exploit
to press/to extract (juice)/device for extracting juice, oils etc

sentences.english: He makes fresh orange juice with an electric extractor.
sentences.chinese: 他用電動榨汁機榨取新鮮的橙汁。

sentences.english: So that Shakespeare's own sovereignty will, Been a heavy Oppression.
sentences.chinese: 使莎士比亞的自我主權心志，遭到了綦重繁重榨取。

sentences.english: Her relatives leeched her for her money like parasites.
sentences.chinese: 她的親戚像寄生蟲似地“榨取”她的錢財。

sentences.english: North Korea has for years relied on its nuclear build-up to squeeze aid from its neighbors and the United States.
sentences.chinese: 北韓多年來靠本國的核武庫向鄰國及美國榨取援助。

sentences.english: Those blackmailers intended to squeeze more money out of him.
sentences.chinese: 那些恐嚇者打算向他榨取更多的錢。

sentences.english: The blackmailer milked his victims of huge amounts of money.
sentences.chinese: 敲詐者從受害人身上榨取了大量金錢。

sentences.english: His illegal deal is steadily milking the profit from the business.
sentences.chinese: 他在搞非法交易不斷榨取公司的利潤。

sentences.english: Its fruit and extracts contain proteins, coagulants, and powerful astringents.
sentences.chinese: 它的果實榨取物含有蛋白質，凝血劑和強大的收斂劑。
善於從同胞的悲痛裏榨取歡悅。

sentences.english: The capitalists batten on the blood of the workers.
sentences.chinese: 資本家靠榨取工人的血汗來養肥自己。

sentences.english: Whales after whales were caught and squeezed to buckets of oil.
sentences.chinese: 大量的鯨魚被捕殺榨取鯨油。

sentences.english: We have not crushed the joy to the utmost to wring from it the wine of pain.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有把喜樂壓成微塵來榨取痛苦之酒。

sentences.english: He leeched his father for his fortune.

definition: to press/to squeeze/to extract juice, oil etc by squeezing
to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)
to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
to make a profit/to earn a packet
to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
